Post_Text: This is Dwangwa road washed away by flooding water

#ZBSNewsA report on the status of irrigation farming after the recent flood disaster in Nkhotakota district shows that eight irrigation schemes have been damaged.It further indicates that over K900 million is needed for rehabilitation and general recovery.Principal Irrigation Engineer for Nkhotakota District Council, Vincent Phiri, says the report has since been sent to various bodies for support and some short term initiatives will be carried out.According to the report, the eight irrigation schemes are Bua, Lipimbi, Chilingali, Chiwale, Karweya, Kakasi B, Chitsanzo and Chithowe.Some crops, water pipes, pillars and canals are some of the those that were  washed away by the floods.(by Winstone Kaimira‚ÄìNkhotakota:03/14/24)#malawismostfollowedpage
text_location: e Bua, Lipimbi, Chilingali, Chiwale, Karweya, Kakasi B, Chitsanzo and Chithowe Irrigation schemes

Post_Text:
#ZBSNews
One person is confirmed dead after a canoe that was being used to rescue him from flooding water capsized at Dwangwa in Nkhotakota district.
This was disclosed today during a district stakeholders meeting on the floods.
A district level team tasked to mobilize humanitarian support for thousands of people affected by the floods has since been established.
The committee is expected to reach out to organisations as well as individuals, seeking the support according to Nkhotakota District Council Acting Director of Economic Planning and Development, Davies Kavalo.
"Let's work as a family, we are one", said Kavalo.
(by Winstone Kaimira - Nkhotakota : 02/29/24)
#malawismostfollowedpage

#ZBSNews
The health office in Nkhotakota says 15 cases of conjunctivitis disease have been registered in camps that are accommodating flood survivors at Dwangwa in the district.   
Director of Health Services in the district, Dr. Jacob Kafulafula, says people suffering from the disease which is also known as ‚Äúpink eye‚Äù have since been isolated to control its spread.
‚ÄúWe have also encouraged people to use hygiene measures such as washing hands and not sharing utensils‚Äù, said Dr. Kafulafula adding that clinical services are being offered in the camps.  
He however expressed concern over the tendency of using traditional medicines to treat the disease saying this is leading to some complications.
A total of 116 cases of the disease have been registered in health facilities of the district namely Nkhunga, Matiki, Ngala and Mtosa according to Dr. Kafulafula.
( by Winstone Kaimira - Nkhotakota : 03/10/24)
#malawismostfollowedpage

#ZBSNews
This is a house of a teacher at Chauma Primary School which has been temporarily closed due to floods in Nkhotakota district.
The government owned Junior Primary School was opened in 1995 according to Headmaster, Dustan Kwacha.
It has three makeshift houses and one which was constructed using cement bricks.
Kwacha says two houses of this nature were constructed under the School Improvement Grant - SIG to reduce the challenge of shortage of teacher houses.
There is also a borehole which was submerged in water during the floods but is now being used although the headmaster says sometimes frogs have been coming out together with water meant for drinking.
( by Winstone Kaimira - Nkhotakota : 03/09/24)
#malawismostfollowedpage

Anthu asanu9), omwe adatsakamira m'mitengo kamba ka madzi osefukira, tsopano awapulumutsa mdera la mfumu yayikulu Kanyenda ku Dwangwa m'boma la Nkhotakota.
M'modzi mwa ogwira ntchito ku khonsolo ya m'bomali yemwenso akugwira ntchito yopulumutsa anthuwa, a John Manda wati ena mwa anthuwa apulumutsidwa usiku ndi apolisi aku Nkhunga.
Zinthu zafika poipa kwambiri m'bomali pomwe nyumba komanso ina yakokoloka pomwe misewu ina ikuduka kamba ka madzi osefukirawa.
Anthu ena akupitilirabe kugwira njakata pomwe maboti omwe akugwiritsidwa ntchito pa ntchito yopulumutsa anthuyi sakugwira ntchito moyenera kamba kakuchuluka kwa madzi.
Pakadalipano, mvula yakata pa Nkhotakota Boma pomwe ku Dwangwa komwe madziwa avuta kwambiri ikupitilirabe.
Wolemba: Samuel Duncan (9), omwe adatsakamira m'mitengo kamba ka madzi osefukira, tsopano awapulumutsa mdera la mfumu yayikulu Kanyenda ku Dwangwa m'boma la Nkhotakota.

KU DWANGWA
Mmawa uno ndati ndikambopo za kusefukira Kwa madzi omwe awononga ndi kusokoneza miyoyo ya anthu komanso machitavhita a malonda mudelari. Pepani Kwa ONSE okhudzidwa.
Mwanjira ya pa Dera ndiperekeko mbiri ya kusefukira Kwa madzi mudelari kutsatira kuti ndinabadwira komanso kulira ku Kasasa kenako ku Mess kapena kuti ku Robert's.
Muchaka Cha 1989 Bambo anga anatitenga pagalimo kukationetsa madzi osefukira mu mtsinje wa Dwangwa sitinaoloke ulalo(bridge) koma tinangoyandikira kumaona madzi atasefukira kudutsa pomwe ayendapo momwe Pali mzere wofirapo mu chithunzi ndipo pomwepo ngati mwana ndimadziwa kuti malowa ndi Dela loophya kukhalapo.
Zoterezi zinachitikanso mu Chaka Cha 1999 pa Malo omwewo kudula nsewu kugukulanso Manda omwe Ali ku mmawako, kenako mu 2009 ndipo madzi akasedukira amoloka Malo omwewo koma popita nthawi nditayamba kukhala ku Blantyre chifukwa cha sukulibntamaliza form 4 mdinabwa kuti Pamalopa pa mangidwa nyumba zokhalamo komanso zochitira malonda ndipo ndinafunsa abale ena kuti zatheka bwanji izi ndimomwe pamaophyera mu nthawi ya mvula mtsinje ukadzadza nkusefukira????

Munthu m‚Äômodzi wamwalira bwato, lomwe limapulumutsa anthu omwe agwira njakata kamba ka madzi osefukira ku Dwangwa m'boma la Nkhotakota, litatembenuzika.M‚Äôneneri wa khonsolo ya bomali, a Wongani Mkandawire auza Times 360 Malawi kuti bamboyu adali mlonda yemwe amagwira ntchito pa malo ena ogona alendo mderali.A Mkandawire atinso pakadalipano, chiwerengero cha anthu omwe akhudzidwa ndi madzi osefukirawa m‚Äômadera a mafumu akuluakulu a Mphonde, Kanyenda ndi Malengachanzi m'bomali chafika pa 6, 145.Mphindi zingapo zapitazo, mfumu yayikulu Mphonde ya m'bomali yatiuza kuti, anthu omwe ali msukulu komanso m‚Äômakachisi osiyanasiyana mdera lake akufunika thandizo la zakudya mwansanga.Ntchito yofikira anthu ndi thandizoli ikukhala yovuta kamba koti malo ena a msewu wa M5 waduka.M‚Äôneneri wa polisi ya Nkhotakota a Paul Malimwe wati anthu awiri apulumutsidwa galimoto lawo litakoloka ndi madzi dzulo pomwe  adanyozera chenjezo loti asadutse malo omwe pali mlatho wa Kaombe ndi malo ochitira chipikisheni a Kaombe.Wolemba:  Samuel Duncan

M'MODZI WAFA NDI MADZI OSEFUKIRA KU NKHOTAKOTA:
Ofesi yowona za ngozi zogwa mwadzidzidzi m‚Äôboma la Nkhotakota yatsimikiza kuti munthu m‚Äômodzi wafa pomwe ena 9 avulala kaamba ka madzi osefukira omwe akhudza madera ena m‚Äôbomali.
Yemwe akugwirizira udindo wa ofesiyi, George Zibophe wati pakadali pano anthu omwe azunguliridwa ndi madzi akuthandizidwa ndi asilikali a MDF pomwe bungwe lowona za ngozi zogwa mwadzidzidzi la DODMA layamba kupeleka thandizo la chakudya kwa anthu omwe akhudzidwa.
Zibophe wati chiwelengero cha anthu omwe akhudzidwa chapitilira 6,000 ndipo ena mwa iwo akusungidwa m‚Äômisasa isanu yomwe yakonzedwa m'dera la Dwangwa.

Nkhotakota floods affect 14,176 people as death toll hits six
The Department of Disaster Management Affairs (DoDMA) in the Office of the President and Cabinet, says the Nkhotakota flash floods have affected 14,176 people as the death toll has risen to six.

Nsewu waduka

Ntchito yopulumutsa anthu omwe akhudzika ndi madzi osefukira ku Dwangwa m'dera la mfumu yayikulu Kanyenda m'boma la Nkhotakota yayamba yaima kaye kaamba ka madzi ochuluka omwe akupitilira kubwera.
Anthu ochuluka agwirabe njakata mdera la Ngalatete mfumu yaikulu Mphonde ngakhale anthu opulumutsa anzawo ku ngozi zogwa mwadzidzidzi akhala akugwira ntchitoyi usiku onsewu.
Mmodzi mwa anthu omwe akugwira nawo ntchitoyi a John Manda apa khonsolo ya bomali auza A Malawi m'mawa uno kuti, mdera la Ngalatete lokha kwatsala chiwerengero cha anthu oposa 200 omwe adakali kakasi.
Dzulo usiku, yemwe akugwirizira udindo wa mkulu wa ofesi yoona za ngozi zogwa mwadzidzidzi a George Zibophe adati maboti omwe akugwira ntchitoyi akukumana ndi vuto la kuonongeka.
Pakadalipano, mvula yomwe idaleka kugwa dzulo m'mawa yayambanso usiku wathawu ndipo ikupitilirabe.
Madera a mafumu akuluakulu Mphonde ndi Kanyenda ndiomwe akhudzidwa kwambiri ndi kusefukira kwa madzi m'bomali.

Nthambi yowona za ngozi zogwa mwadzidzidzi yalengeza za kusefukira kwa madzi m'ma boma a Nkhotakota  ndi  Karonga.
Malingana ndi mkulu ku nthambiyi Charles Kalemba, mvula yamphamvu yomwe yagwa  mu boma la Nkhotakota yazetsa kusefukira kwa misinje ya  Dwangwa ndi  Kaombe zomwe zakhudza anthu am'madera ozungulira.
Kalemba wati izi zapangitsa kuti milatho komaso misewu iwonongeke kwambiri, kotero anthu am'madera okhudzidwa akulephera kuti apeze thandizo loyenera.
Iye watinso malingana ndi malipoti omwe alandira kuchokera ku nkhonsolo ya boma la Karonga, mabanja okwanira 619 ochokera mu dela la mfumu Kyungu akhudzidwa ndi kusefukira kwa madzi kutsatira kudzadza kwa msinje wa  North Rukuru River. 
Mwa mabanjawa, nyumba 38 zagweratu pomwe zina 109 zangowonongeka.
Pakadali pano nthambiyi yati yakwanitsa kupereka thandizo loyenera monga Chimanga, Ufa, Nyemba ndi zina.
Nthambiyi yalangizaso anthu omwe akukhala m'madera omwe ali pa chiwopsezo cha kusefukira kwa madzi kuti asamukire m'madera okwera.
*MALAWI NEWS FLASH*ÔøΩÔøΩ
Ngati njira imodzi yothana ndi njala, yomwe yavuta m'dziko muno, mtsogoleri wakale wa dziko lino, a Joyce Banda, ati apitilira kugawa chimanga kwa anthu amene akhudzika ndi vutoli.
A Banda akugawa matumba 600 a chimanga kwa anthu aku Zomba Malosa.
Ichitu ndi chimanga chomwe iwo apempha kwa Prophet Shepherd Bushiri, yemwe adalonjeza kufikira anthu okwana 1 million ndi thandizo longa ili.

Post_Text: Serious flooding from Kaombe to Dwambazi in Nkhotakota. People have lost houses and property. Not good. People are struggling right now. People need urgent assistance.

Several people are reportedly in dire need of help after being trapped by flooding water in some parts of Nkhotakota following a heavy downpour.
Nkhotakota District Council‚Äôs acting disaster risk management officer George Zibophe has told  Malawi that they have sourced boats locally for a rescue mission.
‚ÄúCommunities around nkhotakota Bua, Dwangwa and Kaombe rivers are the most affected. Many houses have been damaged but no verification has been done due to persistent rainfall and impassable roads,‚Äù.
The heavy downpour, which started yesterday in the lakeshore district, has submerged a stretch from Kaombe Bridge to Kaombe road block on the M5 road, rendering it impassable.

Terrible! Dwangwa-Nkhotakota floods. Prayers

The majority of Malawians rely on rain-fed agriculture, which makes them to be highly dependent on weather patterns and more vulnerable when the weather patterns are unpredictable. Climate change increasingly exacerbates droughts, flooding and inconsistent rainfall contributing to extreme poverty, and food insecurity. This is not just affecting the livelihood of the communities but also Malawi's economy.

* Note *
- Such is life in modern farming, we always plan, do everything right but 'Climate change' isn't something we can easily control, I hope the right interventions are given to all affected people.

Update ku dwangwa nkhotakotaüëá
Munthu m‚Äômodzi wamwalira bwato, lomwe limapulumutsa anthu omwe agwira njakata kamba ka madzi osefukira ku Dwangwa m'boma la Nkhotakota, litatembenuzika.
M'neneri wa khonsolo ya bomali, a Wongani Mkandawire ati bamboyu adali mlonda yemwe amagwira ntchito pa malo ena ogona alendo mderali.
A Mkandawire atinso pakadalipano, chiwerengero cha anthu omwe akhudzidwa ndi madzi osefukirawa m‚Äômadera a mafumu akuluakulu a Mphonde, Kanyenda ndi Malengachanzi m'bomali chafika pa 6, 145.
Mphindi zingapo zapitazo, mfumu yayikulu Mphonde ya m'bomali yati anthu omwe ali msukulu komanso m'makachisi osiyanasiyana mdera lake akufunika thandizo la zakudya mwansanga.
Ntchito yofikira anthu ndi thandizoli ikukhala yovuta kamba koti malo ena a msewu wa M5 waduka.
M‚Äôneneri wa polisi ya Nkhotakota a Paul Malimwe wati anthu awiri apulumutsidwa galimoto lawo litakoloka ndi madzi dzulo pomwe  adanyozera chenjezo loti asadutse malo omwe pali mlatho wa Kaombe ndi malo ochitira chipikisheni a Kaombe.

Update on our situation. We were in Dwangwa Town this week when the storm hit the area and the rivers flooded. The Dwangwa River bridge is flooded and the road is damaged as is the river further South near Nkhotakhota. The bridge 25km north is broken with only a foot crossing available. Given and Vicky were able to cross over and get transport back to Kande. We are safe and staying with Dan and Trish at Ngala Lodge 20km north of Dwangwa until the roads are repaired and we can drive back. Just another adventure in Malawi.

Watch a documentary on Dwangwa Flood. Please share this video in order to reach as many wellwishers as possible. Let's come together to help the victims of Dwangwa Floods.
